body_content.explanation: available for some members of the public to use, visit, or see at certain times:
examples: The author's tour schedule included a number of semi-public appearances sponsored by local library groups.
All of the county's public and semipublic swimming pools are inspected twice a year.

body_content.explanation: partly but not completely owned by the public:
examples: The US Federal Reserve is a semi-public institution that regulates the country's monetary system.
Veterans' organizations are treated as semi-public charities for tax purposes.
As a semipublic organization, we receive some public funding, as well as annual fees from our members.

body_content.explanation: able to be seen or noticed by a lot of people:
examples: She has been at the centre of the semi-public negotiations in the past few weeks.
The two politicians have had several semipublic disagreements.
